proto_particle_definition: A proto-particle P is an attractor A with discrete, stable identity across χ and ρ, plus fixed curvature, metric, and oscillation characteristics.

stability_conditions.adjacency_stability: E(P, X) is χ-invariant for all neighbors X in the interaction graph where Ω allows.
stability_conditions.curvature_invariance: dλ(P)/dχ = 0 under ordinary χ-evolution (excluding explicit transition events).
stability_conditions.mode_invariance: ψ(P) = ψ* (ψ-spectrum fixed up to Ω-symmetries).
stability_conditions.metric_saturation: μ(P) is locally maximal within its semantic neighborhood.

classification.psi_dominant: High oscillatory amplitude, moderate λ, low-to-moderate μ.
classification.lambda_dominant: Deep curvature wells, modest ψ, moderate μ.
classification.mu_dominant: High μ-density, low ψ amplitude, variable λ.
